conclusion: Determine the change in magnetic flux as the coil rotates 60° downward around the z-axis.
Initial position of the coil is such that the magnetic field B is along the positive x-axis.
The area of the coil A is 0.4 m² and the magnetic induction intensity B is 0.1 T.
Initial angle θ_i between the magnetic field and the normal to the coil is 0°.
Calculate initial magnetic flux Φ_i using Φ_i = B * A * cos(θ_i).
Substitute values to find Φ_i = 0.04 Wb.
After rotating 60° downward, the angle θ_f between the magnetic field and the normal to the coil is 60°.
Calculate final magnetic flux Φ_f using Φ_f = B * A * cos(θ_f).
Substitute values to find Φ_f = 0.02 Wb.
Calculate change in magnetic flux ΔΦ = Φ_f - Φ_i.
Substitute values to find ΔΦ = -0.02 Wb.
The change in the magnetic flux passing through the coil is -0.02 Wb.
